business.headline: Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

CA explains how Rs 80,000 per month income can beat Rs 2 lakhThe CA's insights suggest that intentional financial management is key to wealth building. A clear financial purpose can transform how resources are allocated, leading to sustainable growth.

Sensex jumps over 1,100 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The primary catalyst for this rally was the RBI's announcement concerning infrastructure financing. The central bank has implemented new norms that relax provisioning requirements for under-construction infrastructure projects.

Power Finance Corporation share price jumps 6% today. Here's whyWhile PFC has faced some pressure in recent months, with its stock falling 9.14% in the last six months and 14.44% over the past year, Friday's gain marks a strong rebound following the regulatory update.
Sensex opens 228 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Nestle gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 160.43 points to 81,522.30, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,829.70 as of 9:23 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market open higher? Check key levelsAs of 8:00 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,800. This suggests that the Nifty50 may open near its previous closing level of 24,793.25.

Stocks to watch today: Oswal Pumps, Biocon, United Spirits, Sai Life SciencesShares of Nestle India could be in focus after the company announced that its Board of Directors will meet on June 26. They will consider a proposal to issue bonus shares.

entertainment.headline: Aandhi: A cinematic storm that echoed Indira's era'Aandhi' is a classic political satire that delicately portrays the personal sacrifices behind public power, drawing subtle parallels with Indira Gandhi's life. The film remains a timeless gem, celebrated for its nuanced storytelling and memorable performances in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan, 59, says he has brain aneurysm and AV malformationSalman Khan spoke candidly about his severe health issues, including trigeminal neuralgia, AV malformation and brain aneurysm, during his appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show.
Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar dies by suicide at 34Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar was found dead in his Goregaon West flat. Police suspect suicide caused by prolonged stress over lack of work.

Amitabh Bachchan admires son Abhishek, calls him true inheritor in new postAmitabh Bachchan has expressed heartfelt admiration for his son Abhishek Bachchan's dedication and courage as an artist. The proud father also shared his blessings for his upcoming film 'Kaalidhar Laapata'.

Veteran actor Jack Betts, known for Spider-Man, dies at 96Actor Jack Betts, renowned for his role as Henry Balkan in 'Spider-Man', died peacefully at his home. Tributes poured in from fans and theatre communities remembering his remarkable career.

Jana Nayagan: Thalapathy Vijay's first glimpse out on 51st birthdayThalapathy Vijay's final film 'Jana Nayagan' teaser was unveiled on his 51st birthday, showing him in a fierce police avatar. The film will release on January 9, 2026.

Salman Khan's Tere Naam look was inspired by APJ Abdul KalamActor Salman Khan revealed that his look in 'Tere Naam' was inspired by Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. He made this revelation during his appearance on the new season of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'.
Mohanlal announces Drishyam 3, eyes October 2025 releaseThe much-anticipated 'Drishyam 3', starring Mohanlal, has been announced. The actor shared the announcement on June 21.

Kaalidhar Laapata trailer: Abhishek Bachchan seeks joy in slice-of-life filmAfter 'Housefull 5', actor Abhishek Bachchan is set to surprise fans with a new avatar in his upcoming film 'Kaalidhar Laapata'. The trailer for the film, which will premiere on Zee5, was released on Saturday.

Yeh Rishta... actor Lataa Saberwal announces separation from husband Sanjeev SethTV actor Lataa Saberwal has announced her separation from her actor-husband Sanjeev Seth. The duo met on the sets of 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' and got married in 2009.

Was given a bowl to pee: Randeep Hooda on his wedding ceremony with Lin LaishramActor Randeep Hooda shared the nuances of his traditional Manipuri wedding ceremony with Lin Laishram. The actor recalled that he was given a bowl to pee during the ceremony.

Sunjay Kapur's final moments: CPR attempted after heart attack during polo matchBusinessman and Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, died of a heart attack during a polo match in England. His funeral was held in New Delhi, with family and friends in attendance.

Allu Arjun shares sweet birthday wish for mother Nirmala with cute picTollywood actor Allu Arjun wished his mother, Nirmala Allu, on her birthday on Saturday. Along with the note, he posted an adorable picture of himself with her.

28 Years Later review: Danny Boyle proves third time's a charm in this zombie follow-upReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025'28 Years Later', the third installment in the franchise, brings fresh energy to the zombie genre with a gripping story. Danny Boyle's direction and strong performances make it a thrilling watch that honours the legacy of the original '28 Days Later'.

Vir Das urges fans to watch Aamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par, calls it breezyJoining critics, viewers, and fellow celebrities, actor-comedian Vir Das has added his voice to the growing praise for Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The film, which released in theatres on Friday, has already become a major talking point.

Pakistani actors Sanam Saeed-Mohib Mirza welcome baby boy Vali HasanPakistani actor Sanam Saeed, best known for her role in 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai', welcomed her first child with her actor-husband Mohib Mirza. She shared the name of her baby boy on Instagram.

Dipika Kakar's emotional birthday wish for husband ShoaibActor Dipika Kakar shared a heartfelt note on the occasion of her actor-husband Shoaib Ibrahim's birthday. She thanked him for walking through the best and worst times, and staying by her side.

Kangana Ranaut named brand ambassador for World Para Athletics, expresses prideActor and politician Kangana Ranaut has been named as the official Brand Ambassador for the World Para Athletics Championships. In a heartwarming speech, she expressed gratitude and pride.

Govinda's new look with moustache breaks internet, fans demand comebackBollywood actor Govinda is creating quite a stir online with his latest photos, debuting a fresh new look. While many speculated it might be for an upcoming film, fans also took the opportunity to urge the star to return to the big screen.

general news.headline: Live: Israel launches fresh strikes after Iranian missiles pound Tel AvivIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Iran launched a fresh barrage of missiles towards Israel on Sunday, after a US strike at three of its nuclear facilities. Israeli media report that missiles launched from Iran have struck multiple locations across northern and central Israel, including Haifa, Nes Ziona, Rishon LeZion and Tel Aviv. Emergency services are responding as air raid sirens continue in several areas. Earlier today, US President Donald Trump announced that America has conducted air strikes on three nuclear sites in Iran, namely Fordow, Natanz and Esfahan. After days of deliberation, Trump's move to join Israel's military campaign marks a significant escalation in the regional conflict, which is on its tenth day. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Two caught for harbouring Pahalgam attackers, three LeT terrorists identifiedThe arrested accused, Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar and Bashir Ahmad Jothar, also disclosed the names of three of the terrorists involved in the April 22 attack, in which 25 tourists and a local were killed.

Outrageous: Iran says US strikes on N-sites will have everlasting consequencesAraghchi said the attacks on Iran's peaceful nuclear program were "outrageous" and would carry "everlasting consequences."

Middle East bully Iran's nuclear facilities obliterated: Trump in address to nationIn his address to the nation, US President Donald Trump said that American forces conducted successful airstrikes on Iran's Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan nuclear sites, calling them a major blow to Tehran's nuclear program.

Why height is a big filter in dating, marriage marketTinder's new height filter has formalised what was once an unspoken bias, height, as a key marker of desirability, especially for men. From arranged marriage proposals to queer dating spaces, taller men are still preferred, often tied to outdated ideas of masculinity, safety, and status.

Fordow, Natanz, Isfahan: All about Iran's nuclear sites bombed by USPresident Donald Trump said the strikes, which he described as 'very successful,' had hit the Natanz, Fordow and Isfahan sites, with Fordow being the primary target. Iran's state-run IRNA news agency confirmed there were attacks early Sunday at all three nuclear sites.

Trump stopped Iran from going nuclear, history will remember: NetanyahuIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu lauded what he called a 'bold decision' by US President Donald Trump to bomb Iran's nuclear sites, saying it would 'change history.'

US drops never-before-used GBU-57 bunker buster bombs on Iran N-site: ReportB-2 bombers struck Iran's nuclear sites using GBU-57 bunker-buster bombs, designed to penetrate deep underground. Each B-2 carries two 30,000-pound MOPs, ideal for destroying fortified facilities like Fordow.

Satellite captures unusual activities at Iran's key nuclear site before US attackIn the days leading up to the US attack on Iran's Fordow site, satellite imagery revealed increased vehicular activity near the entrance of the underground military complex.
Pics: Inside White House's Situation Room as US took out Iranian nuclear sitesThe photos were shared hours after the operation and during Trump's national address on the unfolding situation.

Aviation body launches safety audit framework after Air India crashThe audit covers airlines, maintenance organisations, flying schools, and ground handlers, with officials conducting inspections, interviews, and simulations to assess safety practices, regulatory compliance, and crew performance standards.

Iran launches fresh missile attack at Israel after US strikes, several injuredIsraeli media reported that multiple regions in the country were hit by the latest Iranian strikes. Several eyewitnesses told Reuters that multiple explosions were heard in central Israel. Among the places hit were Haifa, Nes Ziona, the Rishon Lezion area, and Tel Aviv.

India's quantum leap: How Isro and DRDO are building an unhackable futureAt the heart of this revolution is quantum entanglement, a phenomenon Albert Einstein famously described as "spooky action at a distance."

Fordow is gone: US bombs 3 nuclear sites in Iran, Trump says historic momentThe US launched airstrikes on nuclear sites in Iran, marking its first direct military involvement in the conflict. Trump confirmed the strikes, calling them "very successful" on Truth Social.

Rishabh Pant well ahead of MS Dhoni in Tests: Manjrekar makes bold claimSanjay Manjrekar has backed Rishabh Pant as India's best wicketkeeper-batter in the longest format, surpassing even MS Dhoni. The former cricketer highlighted how Pant's impressive record when playing away from home puts him ahead.

Karnataka unveils bill to penalise fake news with strict lawsKarnataka has introduced a new bill to tackle fake news and misinformation on social media. The law proposes strict penalties and a regulatory authority to ensure authentic content and accountability.

Aandhi: A cinematic storm that echoed Indira's era'Aandhi' is a classic political satire that delicately portrays the personal sacrifices behind public power, drawing subtle parallels with Indira Gandhi's life. The film remains a timeless gem, celebrated for its nuanced storytelling and memorable performances in Indian cinema.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!
No contamination, no danger to people: Iran after US strikes its nuke sitesThe organisation reassured the public that safety assessments had shown no radiation leaks at the targeted sites.

Elevated highway develops lateral shift, vehicular movement to Bengaluru stoppedThe Hosur elevated highway has been declared dangerous by officials after the structure developed a lateral shift. A team of experts will visit the site on Sunday and all vehicular movement to Bengaluru has been stopped.

Salman Khan's Tere Naam look was inspired by APJ Abdul KalamActor Salman Khan revealed that his look in 'Tere Naam' was inspired by Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. He made this revelation during his appearance on the new season of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'.

Grave escalation: World leaders react after US bombs Iran's nuclear sitesThe US strike on Iran's nuclear sites drew fierce global reactions — from Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's applause to the United States and Latin American leaders warning of legal violations and an escalating regional crisis.

Salman Khan, 59, says he has brain aneurysm and AV malformationSalman Khan spoke candidly about his severe health issues, including trigeminal neuralgia, AV malformation and brain aneurysm, during his appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show.

Your next roommate might be a robot: How embodied AI is reimagining home lifeFrom vacuuming your floor to reading your mood robots are becoming the new family members. As artificial intelligence takes a physical form, your next room-mate might not be human but still know exactly how you like your coffee. In the race between convenience and companionship, embodied AI is quietly claiming space in our homes and hearts.

sports.headline: Karthik questions Gambhir's communication with Pant in Leeds Test collapseFormer India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik said Rishabh Pant was perhaps asked to curb his natural stroke-play, which ultimately led to the perplexing leave that cost him his wicket.

No fielding medals for Indian team: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar criticised India's fielding after three dropped catches on Day 2 of the first Test against England. India's sloppy fielding allowed England to recover strongly.

Real Madrid's Mbappe skips training again, set to miss Pachuca gameReal Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe missed Saturday's team training and is expected to sit out their Club World Cup Group H clash against Pachuca as he continues to recover from illness, the club confirmed.

Bumrah and the rest: Karthik fumes as India continue to repeat mistakesEngland vs India: Dinesh Karthik criticised India's reliance on Jasprit Bumrah after Day 2 of the first Test against England. Concerns grow over Bumrah's workload as other pacers fail to match his impact.

Ravi Shastri turns umpire in comm box but Joe Root survives an LBW scareFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri turned umpire in the commentary box in response to an LBW appeal by Mohammed Siraj against Joe Root on Day 2 of the ongoing first Test.

Jasprit Bumrah was extremely hard to face but we minimised the damage: DuckettEngland opener Ben Duckett said Jasprit Bumrah was the best fast bowler in the world and extremely tough to face at Headingley, but he and Ollie Pope managed to find a way to tackle him in the first Test.

Pant makes his own plans: Batting coach praises India star's Leeds hundredIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Rishabh Pant's stroke-filled 134 was different from his typically aggressive knocks, as the wicketkeeper showed more restraint and control during his innings. Kotak also admitted that India could not capitalise on their strong position and fell short of the first-innings total they had targeted in the opening Test against England.

Ravi Shastri fumes at lack of support for Jasprit Bumrah in Leeds TestENG vs IND: Former India coach Ravi Shastri was full of praise for Jasprit Bumrah but felt the premier pacer did not get any support from the rest of the bowling attack, with a visible difference in quality.

Jasprit Bumrah is the best bowler in the world right now: England pacer WoodENG vs IND: England pacer Mark Wood has heaped praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him the best bowler in the world at present and a genuine match-winner across formats.

Inter beat Urawa, Bellingham helps Dortmund survive Mamelodi scareInter Milan came from behind to defeat Urawa Red Diamonds 2-1 in a thrilling FIFA Club World Cup match. Jobe Bellingham scored his first goal for Borussia Dortmund, helping the Bundesliga side beat Mamelodi Sundowns 4-3.

Archer inches closer to full fitness, eyes red-ball return for Sussex: ReportEnglish fast bowler Jofra Archer is reportedly set to make his return to red-ball cricket, having been picked for Sussex's upcoming County Championship match against Durham. His performance in the game could determine his chances of featuring in the ongoing Test series against India.

Pant makes his own plans: Batting coach praises India star's Leeds hundredIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Rishabh Pant's stroke-filled 134 was different from his typically aggressive knocks, as the wicketkeeper showed more restraint and control during his innings. Kotak also admitted that India could not capitalise on their strong position and fell short of the first-innings total they had targeted in the opening Test against England.

Jasprit Bumrah is the best bowler in the world right now: England pacer WoodENG vs IND: England pacer Mark Wood has heaped praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him the best bowler in the world at present and a genuine match-winner across formats.

Inter beat Urawa, Bellingham helps Dortmund survive Mamelodi scareInter Milan came from behind to defeat Urawa Red Diamonds 2-1 in a thrilling FIFA Club World Cup match. Jobe Bellingham scored his first goal for Borussia Dortmund, helping the Bundesliga side beat Mamelodi Sundowns 4-3.

Archer inches closer to full fitness, eyes red-ball return for Sussex: ReportEnglish fast bowler Jofra Archer is reportedly set to make his return to red-ball cricket, having been picked for Sussex's upcoming County Championship match against Durham. His performance in the game could determine his chances of featuring in the ongoing Test series against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
